message: Proud to serve the people of the state of New York. Tell us what you care about: https://www.gillibrand.senate.gov

It is long past time for our military leadership to take responsibility for a toxic environment that fosters sexual harassment and assault. We must work hard to build a military justice system worthy of the sacrifices of the men and women of our armed forces.   WATCH: Senator Gillibrand questions General Robert Neller during a hearing of the Senate Armed Services Committee on the Marines United nude photo scandal.

“[The Affordable Care Act] said to women of America ‘You can’t be charged more just because you’re a woman. Imagine becoming pregnant and having your insurer drop your coverage because you are no longer economic or you cost too much money. Imagine being a cancer survivor and having your coverage dropped because you survived cancer and you cost too much money. So if you love women, and you love your mothers and daughters and wives, please do not unwind the Affordable Care Act. We need women’s health protected.”   WATCH: Senator Gillibrand speaks on the Senate Floor on protecting women’s health care under the ACA.

We are proud to serve the people of the great state of New York.   How can our team help you? Tell us what you care about -- connect with us and join the conversation by visiting our official website.
NA
Sen. Gillibrand and the rest of the Senate Democratic Women's Caucus share stories of women and families who'll be impacted by #Trumpcare.

“I am praying for the recovery of Representative Steve Scalise, the staff, and the Capitol Police who were wounded at the horrific scene this morning. God bless the police and first responders for their bravery and for taking quick action to ensure that this tragedy wasn’t worse. Our first responders put their lives on the line for us every day. They are true heroes, and in this moment of darkness, they once again displayed what is best about our country.   I hope the outcome of this tragedy will be unity, where we put our partisan differences aside and recognize that we are all here for a common purpose. An attack on any public servant is an attack on all. As members of Congress, we are not Democrats and Republicans today; we are simply public servants.  It is also essential that we do not allow this attack to make us cower in fear. We cannot and must not retreat from doing what we are here to do - serve the public by being among our constituents and our colleagues. I look forward to playing once again in the Congressional women’s softball game next week, this time with a heavy heart and renewed purpose.” —KG

Senator Kirsten Gillibrand, Senator Cory Booker, and Congressman Steve Cohen announce the re-introduction of the CARERS Act—a bipartisan bill that would allow access to medical marijuana in states where it is legal without fear of federal prosecution.    Learn more: http://bit.ly/2sBsDKg

"If you’re not taking these crimes seriously as an enormous disruption of good order and discipline, I fear that it’s not going to change behavior."   Senator Gillibrand questions General Robert Neller on the Marines United case at a hearing of the Senate Armed Services Committee. Watch here:

As we celebrate our fathers and everything they give to raising our kids and caring for family members, I’d like to talk a bit about the crucial policies needed to level the playing field for all American families.   Our country is long overdue for a comprehensive national paid family leave plan. It protects families and rewards work—not to mention our small businesses and economy.   Today, we’re debating paid leave across the political spectrum, and that’s a good thing! But the Trump Administration’s proposals fall way short of what a real paid leave plan is really about: Giving all workers (not just new parents) the flexibility they need when major life events happen. Trump’s plan would only help new parents, and no one else. Too many would still be stuck choosing between a paycheck and their families.    A real paid leave plan needs to be national, gender-neutral, comprehensive, affordable, and manageable for workers and small businesses. My bill, the FAMILY Act, does all of this—and it only costs about as much as a cup of coffee a week. Wouldn’t you buy that cup of coffee if it meant you had the flexibility to be with your family when they needed you? —KG
This health care fight is about us, about our stories. Your voice matters—don’t be afraid to speak out. #AmericaSpeaksOut

On the Senate Floor this evening, I asked Leader Mitch McConnell to make the full text of the health care bill available to the public for at least 30 days, because the American people deserve full transparency and accountability.   He said no. —KG
Senator Gillibrand, U.S. Senator Bob Casey and Senator Maggie Hassan discuss the hidden Age Tax on older Americans in the Republican health care bill, and its devastating consequences.

When it comes to health care, one of the biggest challenges for many people is the high cost of prescription drugs.   We’ve seen too many cases where drug companies inflate prescription drug prices just because they can get away with it—without any concern for how their actions affect patients, who are desperate for access to life-saving medicine.   Today, I announced the Stop Price Gouging Act, to take on those drug companies that spike their profits by harming consumers. Here’s how you can help spread the word. —KG
Ready to play some ball at tonight's Congressional Women's Softball Game!
Senator Gillibrand's statement on the Senate version of the American Health Care Act. Read more: http://bit.ly/2sW7xpz

Military families make extraordinary sacrifices on behalf of our country, from frequent moves and demanding schedules to the prolonged absence of one or both parents.  But like many working families across the country, they face challenges in obtaining quality, affordable childcare tailored to their unique needs.  After hearing from many of these families, I introduced bipartisan legislation today with Senator Cotton to give them better support and flexibility when seeking out childcare services.  This is an important step forward in both giving military personnel, their spouses, and their children the support they deserve, and in ensuring our military readiness. –KG
Live now → Speaking out tonight on the disastrous Senate Republican health care bill on the steps on the Capitol. Tune in:

It was an honor to be part of this moment last night with my colleagues to make ourselves heard on health care.   To see the group of people gathered on the Capitol steps grow from few to many was astounding, and even more so because we could share with it with hundreds of thousands more right here on Facebook.   This is what democracy looks like. —KG
This is only the beginning of the battle on healthcare—we have a long way to go. We cannot grow tired. We cannot give up.
Our democracy only works when people like you stand up and demand action.

A beautiful day to visit the Adirondack History Museum—and to see the great work being done to help celebrate the anniversary of women’s suffrage in our very own New York State (where the Women’s Rights movement began!)

Here’s something I think you should know a bit more about:   The Department of Education recently made a number of procedural changes to their Office for Civil Rights.   These changes would roll back their ability to enforce Title IX rules and would limit efforts to combat sexual assault on campuses.   Title IX, a law that ensures students can receive an education free of gender-based violence and discrimination, has been one of the most important tools we have for supporting survivors of sexual assault on campuses.   Senator Claire McCaskill and I wrote to Education Secretary Betsy DeVos, calling on her to put students first and reverse this decision. You can read our letter here: http://bit.ly/2sKvKAk   —KG
I’m heading up to Syracuse for a Town Hall this Friday, and I want to hear from you! If you’re in the area, will you join us? —KG
Senator Gillibrand hosts a town hall at Syracuse University to discuss issues like health care, jobs and the economy.
A victory for the grassroots on health care, but we cannot let up now. Here’s why we still need you in the fight.
We’re taking our town hall to the Bronx! I look forward to hearing about the issues that matter to you. Will you join us in New York City on Saturday morning? – KG
Join us in New York City this Saturday morning!

Schools and universities can, and should, do more to ensure fair processes for both survivors and accused students in cases of campus sexual assault. But tearing down policies, like enforcement of Title IX, that have helped to bring these crimes out of the shadows is the wrong approach.   Our work on this issue should be about decency and justice—not false ideology.   Candice Jackson’s attempts to roll back these policies, as well as her dangerous remarks about campus sexual assault cases, make her unworthy of her role as the Acting Assistant Secretary for Civil Rights at the Department of Education.   She should step down. —KG
Thank you to all who made themselves heard at our town hall at Hostos Community College in the Bronx this past weekend!

The opioid epidemic in New York State and across the country is a crisis that must be addressed, and one of its most dangerous root causes is over-prescription for short-term, acute pain.   For example, when someone gets a wisdom tooth out, or breaks their wrist, they don’t need to be sent home from the doctor’s office with 30 Oxycodone pills. It’s simply not necessary, but it happens frequently, and its how many people become addicted to opioids in the first place.  I’ve introduced legislation to address this problem with Senator John McCain, called the Opioid Addiction Prevention Act. Today, I went Jamestown, NY to talk about how this bill will help put a stop to the growing opioid epidemic.   Read more about it here: http://bit.ly/2vG5J2p  —KG
NA
Health care coverage for millions of Americans is at stake today. We need you in our corner—do whatever you can to be heard.
Read Senator Gillibrand’s statement on today’s health care vote: http://bit.ly/2uUCjAw
Read Senator Gillibrand’s statement on President Trump’s decision to ban transgender service members from the military: http://bit.ly/2uYhPqA

I took to the Capitol steps on behalf of the millions of Americans who would be harmed by the Republican health care bill.   This bill is toxic and horrible–and I will keep raising my voice against it. I hope you will too, because this fight is real, it’s a matter of life and death, and it’s about people like you.   –KG

Senator Gillibrand and 44 Senate colleagues wrote to Secretary James Mattis, urging him not to implement President Trump’s cruel, discriminatory transgender ban. Read the letter: http://bit.ly/2tQQdUP

We have the Statue of Liberty in New York Harbor, and it stands for something. It stands for the notion that we welcome refugees, we welcome people in need. We are a country that is big enough and strong enough to help them.                                                                                                                                                                                   Five million immigrants call New York their home. Programs that support immigrants support all New Yorkers, by building up our economy and strengthening our communities. Comprehensive immigration reform that treats workers, families, and children with the respect they deserve is the only way forward.   Read more: bit.ly/2vsP5XM

“Thousands of tourists come from around the world to visit the Finger Lakes Region to experience the beautiful landscape, to learn about our rich history and culture, and to enjoy all that our local businesses have to offer.”  —KG   The Finger Lakes Region has some of the richest history, culture, and beauty in upstate New York. Designating the region as a National Heritage Area would boost the Finger Lakes economy and bring many new visitors to this special part of our state. Learn more: http://bit.ly/2vwRZds

The Hudson River, an American Heritage River, means something to people all across New York. But what does it say about our priorities if the Hudson, one of this country’s most iconic bodies of water, isn’t safe? I’m fighting for the EPA to extend the Hudson River cleanup project because New Yorkers deserve better. If you want a cleaner, healthier river, you can speak out and make your voice heard on this on Wednesday, August 9th, in New York City. Learn more about it: http://bit.ly/2uiLITf —KG
Enjoying a tour of Brewery Ommegang in Cooperstown, New York.

“We must have discussions about how we can reward work in this country, and those are the issues I’m prepared to fight for.”   At her town hall at Hudson Valley Community College in Troy, Sen. Gillibrand discussed some of the best ways to jump start our economy to help workers in New York and across the country.

It’s our duty and responsibility to denounce the hatred and violence we saw in Charlottesville over the weekend.    If the President won’t lead, we will.   Read Senator Gillibrand’s op-ed in the New York Daily News: http://nydn.us/2i7rXby

I found the President’s speech tonight terribly lacking. Lacking in details, lacking in substance and lacking in a vision of what success in Afghanistan looks like.   When committing American service members overseas, the Commander in Chief needs to clearly define the mission and a strategy to achieve success. Until he can do that, expecting service members to fight and possibly die in Afghanistan is a disservice to their sacrifice.   I am skeptical that the President’s ‘new strategy’ will achieve what the last sixteen years could not, and I will be calling for extensive hearings in the Senate where Congress must demand accountability and transparency from this Administration. —KG

Hurricane Harvey has left our friends in Texas and Louisiana in need of our support. Many thanks to the first responders on the ground for their help with relief and rescue efforts.   Here are some ways you can help those who have been affected.

President Trump’s action today is an affront to who we are as Americans. He is needlessly targeting children who know no other country as home than America. This does not make our communities safer or our economy stronger. In fact, it does just the opposite. Congress must lead where the President won't and pass the DREAM Act. America does not merely tolerate immigration – we thrive on it, and we are better than needlessly targeting hardworking young adults to score crass partisan points. —KG

As I’ve been traveling around New York, the number one thing I keep hearing from New Yorkers is that people are very worried that their health care is still too expensive.   Under the health care system we have now, too many insurance companies continue to value their profits more than they value the people they are supposed to be helping. It’s time for something better.  So I’ll be fighting with U.S. Senator Bernie Sanders – and I hope with all of you – to pass Medicare-for-All and finally give every American access to affordable, good-quality health care. —KG  Read more: http://bit.ly/2w499AJ
It’s time to fight for universal coverage and pass Medicare for All, for the families across America who are counting on us.
NA
NA
LIVE NOW: Sen. Kirsten Gillibrand joins U.S. Senator Bernie Sanders and Senate colleagues to introduce the Medicare for All Act of 2017.
Wonderful farmers and producers from around New York State came to Capitol Hill for New York Farm Day 2017, showing off the best food and produce New York has to offer! Thanks to all who came by.

“To suggest that these brave, tough, and selfless transgender Americans somehow don’t belong in our military is harmful to our military’s readiness—and it’s deeply insulting to our troops.”    On the Senate floor, Sen. Gillibrand talks about her proposal to protect transgender service members.
All Americans deserve affordable, quality care as a matter of right. It’s time to fight for single payer health care.

Senate Republicans are rushing to try to pass yet another bill to repeal the Affordable Care Act.   There’s no time to waste—we must all speak out against their attempts to kick millions off of coverage.
Sen. Gillibrand helps the kids (and future Senators!) of MomsRising.org with their markup of the Graham-Cassidy health care repeal bill.

“It’s not only immoral, it’s insulting, and it’s out of touch with the very real and pressing needs that regular Americans face every single day.”   Sen. Gillibrand joins MomsRising.org and Planned Parenthood to speak out against the awful Graham-Cassidy health care repeal bill.

Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands are suffering from one of the worst disasters our country has ever seen.  The President and Congress must work together to act quickly, and give our fellow American citizens the resources they need to recover.
If you are a New Yorker looking for ways to help our fellow American citizens in Puerto Rico, here are some ways to help.
Dreamers in New York and across the country deserve the chance to keep contributing to the only country they know. We will keep speaking out to defend them. —KG

My heart is with the victims of the horrific mass murder that happened in Las Vegas last night, and their families. I want to thank all the brave first responders who acted so quickly.    These senseless mass shootings must end. We cannot allow this to be the new normal, where tragedy after tragedy happens and we do nothing to address it. It’s not good enough to just send thoughts and prayers and extend our condolences, when people are losing their lives to gun violence.   We are still learning the details about what happened, but here is what we know:   This violence – this mass-murder – is one of the worst massacres we’ve ever seen in our country. And it is yet another reminder of Congress’s failure to act to protect Americans from gun violence.  It’s another disturbing and painful example of how Congress is too weak and too cowardly to stand up to the gun industry. The news reports are saying that the gun was shooting in rapid-fire bursts, for multiple seconds at a time. If that’s what it was, it sounds like a weapon that was specifically designed to kill as many people as possible, as quickly as possible: A weapon of war.  We must pass laws that protect the American people from this kind of horrific violence. The violence in Las Vegas is only the latest tragedy like this. Mass shootings get all the news, but every single day in New York and across the country, gun violence on a much smaller scale is destroying more and more lives.    We must act. We must take gun violence as seriously as we take the threat of terrorism, wherever it is happening. We will get the facts and get to the bottom of this. When we do, let’s honor the lives we have lost by doing something about it – to do everything we can to make sure this never happens again. —KG
In Albany, NY, Sen. Gillibrand delivers remarks on last night’s tragic mass shooting in Las Vegas, NV.
Ending DACA would do enormous damage to our families, to our LGBTQ community, and to so many others. It’s up to all of us to speak out and demand that Congress pass the DREAM Act.

Today, I met with a group of Dreamers from New York State. I was moved by their stories, and by their courage to speak out for hundreds of thousands of Dreamers across the country who are terrified about what might happen to them.  This afternoon, I’ll join U.S. Senate Democrats for a Facebook Live to stand up to the Trump Administration and speak out for them. Tune in on this page. —KG
LIVE: Sen. Gillibrand joins U.S. Senate Democrats to stand up for Dreamers in New York State and across the country.

At a hearing of the Senate Environment and Public Works Committee, I shared the stories of residents from the town of Hoosick Falls, NY.  These New Yorkers were victims of drinking water contamination from a toxic chemical called perfluorooctanoic acid (PFOA), linked to a local Saint Gobain's Plastics plant.  Michael Dourson, the Trump administration’s nominee to lead the Environmental Protection Agency’s chemical safety office, has enabled corporations to pollute water with these kinds of toxic chemicals.  Dourson needed to hear these stories, and understand the terrible impact of the decisions he’s made.  His nomination to the EPA would be a classic example of the fox guarding the hen house. I’ll be voting against him. —KG

The Trump administration’s decision to roll back birth control coverage protections is completely unacceptable.   It’s 2017—a woman’s boss should not be able to decide if she can access birth control.
TOMORROW: Sen. Gillibrand will travel to Puerto Rico to survey hurricane damage and relief efforts.

I just returned from a trip to Puerto Rico to see the hurricane damage and relief efforts. After more than two weeks since Hurricane Maria made landfall, it is clear that our fellow American citizens still desperately need our help. We must do everything we can to help them recover and rebuild. —KG
Sen. Gillibrand speaks with Vogue about the fights still left to wage, in the Senate and at the grassroots.
The president’s transgender ban is cruel and harmful. We must do everything we can to stand up for brave Americans who are willing to die for this country.

Three weeks after Hurricane Maria, millions of our fellow American citizens in Puerto Rico are still without electricity, water, and food. They cannot wait any longer to receive the urgent assistance they deserve.  Today, Sen. Gillibrand joined six other U.S. Senate Democrats to call on FEMA to provide the necessary funding and resources to rebuild.

With Congress’s failure to renew federal funding for the Children's Health Insurance Program, 350,000 children in New York State – and millions more across the country – are at risk of losing coverage.   Congress must act now and work together to renew this funding as quickly as possible.

No boss should be able to decide if a woman can access birth control.   Sen. Gillibrand weighs in on the Trump administration’s decision to roll back contraception coverage for millions of American women:

“Dreamers are our leaders, our teachers, our innovators, our scientists. They are part of our future. Dreamers become doctors, they start businesses, they are entrepreneurs, they strengthen our economy. We have to do everything we can to protect our Dreamers from being deported – and we also need to do everything we can to protect them from being targeted and marginalized.”  Sen. Gillibrand calls on Congress to quickly pass the DREAM Act.

What we are seeing from the powerful #MeToo campaign is that sexual assault and harassment are pervasive across our entire society. What you see time and again in institutions all around the country is a culture where power and fear keep sexual assault and harassment in the shadows.   Congress is no different. Today, I’ve announced that I will be introducing comprehensive legislation to reform the way the Congress handles sexual harassment. —KG

Plain and simple, Americans are being slaughtered and Congress is refusing to protect them. And I hear those who rightly say we can’t pass laws to stop every instance of a deranged gunman who wants to kill innocent men, women, and children—just like our other criminal laws won’t necessarily stop every instance of crime.   But there is no excuse for not even trying.

Today, I visited the Palmyra VFW Post 6778 in Wayne County to discuss two pieces of legislation that I'm fighting to pass—one that will boost federal employment for veterans, and another that will protect veterans’ rights to justice in court.   As we honor veterans and service members who have sacrificed an enormous amount for our country, we owe it to them to make sure that when they are back in the civilian world, they have access to good-paying jobs and all of their legal rights to protect themselves in the workplace.
I’m hoping to do my part to reform processes in the halls of Congress so that victims of sexual harassment can come forward without fear. —KG
It is clear that the Republican tax plan will harm hard working middle class families in New York State. We must all do our part to speak out against it.

In recent months, scandal after scandal has shown that sexual assault and harassment remain pervasive in the U.S. military.   There are no more excuses. It’s time to protect the service members who honorably serve us and pass the Military Justice Improvement Act.   Learn more: gillibrand.senate.gov/mjia #passMJIA

It is abundantly clear that the status quo is not working to address the crisis of military sexual assault.     Today, I am re-introducing my bipartisan Military Justice Improvement Act. Watch live, then take the time to speak out to #PassMJIA. —KG

Leading the EPA’s chemical safety office bears an enormous responsibility to keep our families and communities safe from chemical contamination. I don’t trust Michael Dourson to take that seriously.   Therefore, I’m placing a hold on his nomination to block his confirmation process from moving forward. —KG

The Military Justice Improvement Act would establish an impartial, fair, and accountable justice system to finally address the crisis of sexual assault in our military.   Learn more: gillibrand.senate.gov/mjia  #passMJIA

As we sit back and reflect on all of our blessings today, I want to share a bit about how grateful I am for the opportunity to serve the people of New York State.    This year, I made it my goal to meet with New Yorkers in every corner of the state, in all 62 counties. This week, in Orleans County, we hit number 62!   Here are some highlights from the past year. It has been an honor to hear your stories and learn more about the issues that matter most to you. I hope to take that with me in the weeks and months ahead.    Wishing you and your family a very safe, restful, and happy Thanksgiving. —KG

The harmful Republican tax plan could come to a vote in the Senate this week, and it is up to all of us to fight back on behalf of every hardworking middle class family that could see a tax increase.   Tonight, I joined my Democratic colleagues to speak out. —KG

WATCH LIVE: As millions in Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands continue to struggle after the devastating impact of Hurricanes Maria and Irma, Sen. Gillibrand joins colleagues to introduce legislation to fund a massive recovery effort.
The Republican tax plan helps the people and corporations who don't need any extra help—and it ignores the people who do.

The Republican tax plan is a blatant attempt to take millions of families’ hard-earned money to hand over to rich corporations on the Fortune 500 list. As the Senate prepares to vote on it today, it is up to all of us to raise our voices and stop it in its tracks.

When President Trump announced his decision to end the DACA program, it was one of the most inhumane actions of his entire presidency.   Ending DACA will force thousands of Dreamers to lose their jobs, it will force them into hiding, and it will force them to have to make the unimaginable choice between either staying in this country undocumented or being forced out of the only country they have ever called home. This goes against our most fundamental values as Americans and as New Yorkers.   Congress must take action to reverse this decision. Very soon, the Senate will have to pass a long-term spending bill to keep the government running. Republican leadership has not yet committed to including a provision in that bill to protect Dreamers.   If they refuse to do the right thing and protect Dreamers in this must-pass bill, then I will vote against it.   We should not allow our Dreamers, who contribute so much to our communities, to be used as political pawns. We should simply do what both parties have said is the right thing to do. This issue is a matter of basic human rights and human dignity. I hope you will join me in this fight. —KG

For all the brave women and men out there who have come out to tell their stories about sexual harassment and assault in the workplace, there are likely many more in the shadows who want to speak out, but can’t, because they are forced to choose between keeping their jobs and pursuing justice.  This happens because of forced arbitration “agreements” in the workplace that many companies use to avoid the court system in these cases. Forced arbitration ultimately hides bad behavior and prevents victims from coming forward.   This week, Rep. Cheri Bustos, U.S. Senator Lindsey Graham, and I introduced bicameral, bipartisan legislation to make this practice illegal.
It’s time to end uncertainty for the hundreds of thousands of Dreamers who know no other home but this country.   We must keep fighting for them. And we must pass the #DreamActNow.

Today, the Federal Communications Commission will vote on a proposal to wipe out Net Neutrality, rules that ensure that the internet is free and open to the millions of people who use it every single day. This could have real consequences for the women who are using the new digital economy to start businesses, to organize movements, to share their stories. I wrote more about this at Refinery29:

Many manufacturing companies in New York State have job openings with good salaries, but they can’t fill them because too many workers haven’t had the opportunity to learn the high-tech skills they need to take on those jobs.   I’ve introduced bipartisan legislation that will help our students learn these necessary skills. My bill would set aside funding for modern-day tech-ed shop classes that would train students to use tools, like 3D printers, that manufacturing companies expect them to know how to use. I had the opportunity to visit the Newburgh Free Academy, a school that offers students the chance to take one of these classes.

The tax bill that just passed the Senate is rotten. It gives huge tax cuts to big corporations and the wealthiest among us, at the expense of hard-working middle class families in New York State and across the country. It will raise the cost of health insurance for millions of people. It could lead to drastic cuts to Medicare, Medicaid, and Social Security. It adds trillions to our country’s deficit.  I’m as disappointed as you are. But while we may have lost our fight today, we cannot get discouraged. So many of you voiced your fervent opposition to this bill through phone calls, letters, emails, actions. We still need that energy. We still need your voice. I hope you’ll keep on as we tackle the tough fights ahead. —KG

For every week that Congress refuses to take action, more and more Dreamers lose their DACA status and face the risk of deportation. Time is running out. Congress must lead and do the right thing to protect them. #DreamActNow
